intro: Tecoma loxensis, commonly known as the yellow bells, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth texture. Tecoma loxensis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
